snippet: Property taxes help cover health costs for the uninsured, a burden on residents that Gov. Rick Perry’s rejection of Medicaid expansion would maintain.
abstract: Texas Gov Rick Perry's decision to refuse federal health care law provisions expanding Medicaid and creating a state insurance exchange will be felt in the state's counties; some local leaders say decision will hurt county taxpayers, whose property taxes help cover health costs for the uninsured.
lead_paragraph: Property taxes help cover health costs for the uninsured, a burden on residents that Gov. Rick Perry’s rejection of Medicaid expansion would maintain.

headline.seo: Texas Counties Fear Cost of Medicaid Rebuff
headline.main: Texas Counties Fear Residents Will Pay the Price of Perry’s Medicaid Rebuff
headline.print_headline: Texas Counties Fear Residents Will Pay the Price of Perry’s Medicaid Rebuff

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
